title: Adhere To Quality Standards
text:
21:48 CET Adhere To Quality Standards By Emmanuel Amoquandoh 
Ahead of preparations towards the 46 th World Standards Day, the Ghana Standards Authority (GSA) has organised the third of its kind, an open day for students of some tertiary institutions in the country. 
The tertiary institutions involved were the Accra Polytechnic, University of Professional Studies and Radford University. The rest are the School of Consumer Sciences and the School of Engineering from the University of Ghana among others. 
Accompanied with some exhibitions of food items and other things, the participants of the open day were taken through the Metrology Laboratory, Food and Drugs, and the Food and Drinks laboratory as well as the Forensic and Pesticides laboratory. 
The purpose of the open day was to acquaint the participants to understand the adherence to quality standards in every facet of human life. 
According to Kofi Amponsah Bediako, Head of Public Relations at the GSA, People thought standards do exist for some few things but they are beginning to appreciate standards, which spans wide to every service, giving better results when applied in management systems. 
Speaking on the theme, “Standards, The World’s Common Language”, Kofi Amponsah-Bediako, stated that it does not matter which country a product is manufactured but once the International Standards Organisation (ISO), International Electro - Technical Commission (IEC) and other international certification bodies certify it, it brings harmony among trading countries. 
Speaking on health issues, he said, “equipment wear down in accuracy over time and the output of its usage diminishes in efficiency and if those equipments are not re-calibrated, it will give inaccurate readings, which will misinform the medical practitioners to prescribe wrong dosage to patients, leading to serious consequences”. 
In the area of business, Kofi Amposah Bediako mentioned that people go into businesses to make profits and when their machines are calibrated according to quality standards, it will save lives, ensure safety and protect the environment. 
He said adhering to standards helps to reduce waste and promote business in the area of increasing in revenue. 
He stated that among the Economic Community of West African State (ECOWAS), harmonization used to exist between Ghana and Nigeria but now, ECOWAS has embrace the use of standards to be used among member states to promote trade within the ECOWAS Sub-Region. 
He mentioned that trade normally happens among member states of ECOWAS and the European markets because of the existence of standards and this has contributed to the low level of trade among ECOWAS Sub-Region but now that standards are being appreciated within the ECOWAS Sub-Region, trade among member states would grow to appreciable expectations.
